questions.question: What is the sum of the interior angles in a convex nonagon?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: Use the formula (n-2)180 to calculate the sum of the interior angles. Since a nonagon has 9 sides, we get (9-2)180 = (7)180 = 1,260, hence the sum of the interior angles of a convex nonagon is 1,260 degrees.

questions.question: In a parallelogram, what is the relationship between opposite angles?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: <b>Based on the theorems about parallelograms, opposite angles of a parallelogram are equal.<b>

questions.question: What is the measure of each interior angle in a regular heptagon?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation:
In finding out the measure of each interior angle we will use the formula (n-2)180 all over n. Since a heptagon has 7 sides, then n=7.
(7-2)180 all over 7
=> (5)180 divided by 7
=> 900 divided by 7=128.57
Therefore the answer is 128.57 degrees.

questions.question: If a polygon has 20 sides, what is the sum of its exterior angles?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: The exterior angles of all polygons have a sum of 360 degrees.

questions.question: What is the sum of the interior angles in a concave hexagon?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation:
To solve for the sum of interior angles, use the formula (n-2) 180
n = 6, so…
=>(6-2)180
=>(4)180
=> 720
Therefore, the sum of a concave hexagon is 720 degrees.

questions.question: How many sides does a hexagon have?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: Many of our words in math hearken back to the Greek, and hexagon is no exception. The idea of a six-sided figure comes from the Greek “hexagonon”, with gonia meaning “angle”, which makes sense, as a hexagon not only has 6 sides, but six angles, or vertices.

questions.question: What is the sum of the interior angles of a scalene?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation:
A scalene has 3 sides and to find out the sum of the interior angles, we will use (n-2)180 so we will substitute n=3
(n-2)180
=>(3-2)180
=>(1)180
=180 therefore the sum of the interior angles of a scalene is 180 degrees.

questions.question: What type of polygon has all sides and angles equal?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation:
Scalenes have no equal sides.
Isosceles only has 2 equal sides.
Right triangles have one right angle (90 degrees), so it is impossible to share 180 degrees equally.
From the word equal, comes the word “equilateral”.

questions.question: What is the sum of the interior angles of a pentagon?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation:
In finding the sum of the interior we will use the formula (n-2)180. Since a pentagon has 5 sides, then n=5
=>(5-2)180
=>(3)180
=>540
Therefore the answer is 540 degrees.

questions.question: In a parallelogram, adjacent angles are:
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: Based on theorems about parallelograms, adjacent angles are supplementary.
